results.title: Fighting depression
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Hidden depths”.
The director of MIND in Camden, Dr. David Hill, outlines the services offered by his drop-in centre for former patients of psychiatric hospitals, emphasising the need to raise self-esteem so that patients can successfully re-enter normal life without suffering from depression. His methods of counselling, as well as those employed by the women running Women’s Action for Mental Health, are shown. Both organisations concentrate on encouraging and empowering the depressed person through attentive listening, emotional support and client centred group activities.

results.title: What depresses me ...
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Hidden depths”.
Psychotherapy, both in groups and singly, offers those suffering from depression a non-drug solution to their problems. In this program sufferers, psychologists and counsellors discuss the causes of depression (low self-esteem, childhood trauma from physical and sexual abuse, loneliness) and the value of psychotherapy and counselling. Professor David Smail outlines the three stages of therapy and stresses the importance of accurately assessing the limitations on resources for change available to each client and an awareness of the potential for client over-dependence on the comfort offered by the therapist.

results.title: Understandably depressed
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Hidden depths”.
Depression is a state where nothing outside is of any interest any longer (Ruley) “It’s like not feeling quite alive” What exactly is depression? Is it a physical illness or a state of mind? What are the symptoms of depression? Are some people or families more prone to depression than others? Does medication help, or merely prolong the cure? Using the experiences of two depressives, Ruley and John and the opinions of clinical psychologist, Professor David Smail and GP, Dr. Brian Harris, this program attempts to provide some answers on this condition which can affect up to one in four people at some time in their lives.

results.title: Hidden India
results.creator_credit: Ian Austin, Dennis Porter and East Coast Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hidden India Series”.
India is a complex country of multiple languages, lifestyles, religions and cultures which are thousands of years old, a country of hidden wonders which the average tourist never sees. This documentary explores many of these wonders and vividly recounts, even dramatically reconstructs some of India’s intriguing stories.

results.title: 700 Million Faces
results.creator_credit: Ian Austin, Dennis Porter and East Coast Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hidden India Series”.
India is a land of contradictions. Mrs. Ghandi discusses in an in-depth yet light-hearted and often amusing interview, India’s contemporary and greatly diversified lifestyles.

results.title: Might, majesty and mysticism
results.creator_credit: Ian Austin, Dennis Porter and East Coast Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hidden India Series”.
India is synonymous with mysticism and this film goes on to explore the many incredible facets of this way of life - and death. Many people from around the world are flocking to India, not as tourists, not to see the might and majesty (of breathtaking architecture that is)… They come to find themselves through the teachings of the gurus, the powerful holy men. Might and majesty in the guise of mysticism has returned to India.

results.title: Humphrey in the snow
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Here’s Humphrey”.
Join Humphrey on his first visit to the snow where he learns to ski, goes for a ride on a skiddoo, makes a model reindeer with Jodie and plays with snowballs. Humphrey in the snow will delight young children as it is a program filled with fun, games and excitement.

results.title: Risk factors
results.creator_credit: Roger Hudson, Jim Dale, National Heart Foundation of Australia, Suatu Film Management and Mediacast
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Help yourself to health”.
Focuses on the main risk factors in coronary heart disease: prolonged high blood pressure, smoking, excessive fat in diet leading to elevated blood cholesterol levels.
